newsitem.title: USA: US mortgage-backeds tick higher ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: US mortgage-backeds tick higher ahead of holiday.

text.p: U.S. mortgage-backed securities climbed higher across the board in an abbreviated Friday session, with yield spreads widening by a few ticks to Treasuries, particularly in premium coupons, traders said.
Underperforming premiums all week, discount coupons rebounded in today's light market rally, said a New York-based trader.
Although yield spreads are still moderately wider to comparable Treasuries, "(discounts) are doing better today," the trader said. "But they've performed a lot worse over the last couple of days."
Late on Friday, pass-throughs were 11/32 higher in coupons of 7.0 percent and smaller, and were 1/32 to 9/32 in premium coupons. The 10-year Treasury note was up 13/32 to yield 6.56 percent.
Ginnie Mae 30-year 7.5 percent coupons were up 10/32 at 99-13/32, yielding 109 basis points over 10-year Treasuries.
Comparable FNMAs were up 9/32 at 99-10/32, and FHLMCs were up 10/32 at 99-15/32.
The Public Securities Association has recommended an early close of 1400 EDT/1800 GMT for the market and a full close for Columbus Day Monday.
